verses.verse: Then he brought <S%H3318><s%> me forth <S%H3318><s%> into <S%H413><s%> the utter <S%H2435><s%> court, <S%H2691><s%> the way <S%H1870><s%> toward <S%H1870><s%> the north: <S%H6828><s%> and he brought <S%H935><s%> me into <S%H413><s%> the chamber <S%H3957><s%> that was over <S%H5048><s%> against <S%H5048><s%> the separate <S%H1508><s%> place, and which <S%H834><s%> was before <S%H5048><s%> the building <S%H1146><s%> toward <S%H413><s%> the north. <S%H6828><s%>

Before <S%H413><s%> <S%H6440><s%> the length <S%H753><s%> of an hundred <S%H3967><s%> cubits <S%H520><s%> was the north <S%H6828><s%> door, <S%H6607><s%> and the breadth <S%H7341><s%> was fifty <S%H2572><s%> cubits. <S%H520><s%>

Over <S%H5048><s%> against <S%H5048><s%> the twenty <S%H6242><s%> cubits which <S%H834><s%> were for the inner <S%H6442><s%> court, <S%H2691><s%> and over <S%H5048><s%> against <S%H5048><s%> the pavement <S%H7531><s%> which <S%H834><s%> was for the utter <S%H2435><s%> court, <S%H2691><s%> was gallery <S%H862><s%> against <S%H413><s%> <S%H6440><s%> gallery <S%H862><s%> in three <S%H7992><s%> stories.

And before <S%H6440><s%> the chambers <S%H3957><s%> was a walk <S%H4109><s%> to ten <S%H6235><s%> cubits <S%H520><s%> breadth <S%H7341><s%> inward, <S%H6442><s%> a way <S%H1870><s%> of one <S%H259><s%> cubit; <S%H520><s%> and their doors <S%H6607><s%> toward the north. <S%H6828><s%>

Now the upper <S%H5945><s%> chambers <S%H3957><s%> were shorter: <S%H7114><s%> for the galleries <S%H862><s%> were higher <S%H5945><s%> than these, <S%H2007><s%> than the lower, <S%H8481><s%> and than the middlemost <S%H8484><s%> of the building. <S%H1146><s%>

For they were in three <S%H8027><s%> stories, but had not pillars <S%H5982><s%> as the pillars <S%H5982><s%> of the courts: <S%H2691><s%> therefore <S%H5921><s%> <S%H3651><s%> the building was straitened <S%H680><s%> more than the lowest <S%H8481><s%> and the middlemost <S%H8484><s%> from the ground. <S%H776><s%>

And the wall <S%H1447><s%> that was without <S%H2351><s%> over <S%H5980><s%> against <S%H5980><s%> the chambers, <S%H3957><s%> toward <S%H1870><s%> the utter <S%H2435><s%> court <S%H2691><s%> on the forepart <S%H6440><s%> of the chambers, <S%H3957><s%> the length <S%H753><s%> thereof was fifty <S%H2572><s%> cubits. <S%H520><s%>

For the length <S%H753><s%> of the chambers <S%H3957><s%> that were in the utter <S%H2435><s%> court <S%H2691><s%> was fifty <S%H2572><s%> cubits: <S%H520><s%> and, see, <S%H2009><s%> before <S%H5921><s%> <S%H6440><s%> the temple <S%H1964><s%> were an hundred <S%H3967><s%> cubits. <S%H520><s%>

And from under <S%H8478><s%> these <S%H428><s%> chambers <S%H3957><s%> was the entry <S%H3996><s%> on the east <S%H6921><s%> side, <S%H6921><s%> as one goes <S%H935><s%> into them from the utter <S%H2435><s%> court. <S%H2691><s%>

The chambers <S%H3957><s%> were in the thickness <S%H7341><s%> of the wall <S%H1444><s%> of the court <S%H2691><s%> toward <S%H1870><s%> the east, <S%H6921><s%> over <S%H413><s%> <S%H6440><s%> against <S%H6440><s%> the separate <S%H1508><s%> place, and over against <S%H6440><s%> the building. <S%H1146><s%>

And the way <S%H1870><s%> before <S%H6440><s%> them was like the appearance <S%H4758><s%> of the chambers <S%H3957><s%> which <S%H834><s%> were toward <S%H1870><s%> the north, <S%H6828><s%> as long <S%H753><s%> as they, and as broad <S%H7342><s%> as they: and all <S%H3605><s%> their goings <S%H4161><s%> out were both according to their fashions, <S%H4941><s%> and according to their doors. <S%H6607><s%>

And according to the doors <S%H6607><s%> of the chambers <S%H3957><s%> that were toward <S%H1870><s%> the south <S%H1864><s%> was a door <S%H6607><s%> in the head <S%H7218><s%> of the way, <S%H1870><s%> even the way <S%H1870><s%> directly <S%H1903><s%> before <S%H6440><s%> the wall <S%H1448><s%> toward <S%H1870><s%> the east, <S%H6921><s%> as one enters <S%H935><s%> into them.

Then said <S%H559><s%> he to me, The north <S%H6828><s%> chambers <S%H3957><s%> and the south <S%H1864><s%> chambers, <S%H3957><s%> which <S%H834><s%> are before <S%H413><s%> <S%H6440><s%> the separate <S%H1508><s%> place, they be holy <S%H6944><s%> chambers, <S%H3957><s%> where <S%H834><s%> <S%H8033><s%> the priests <S%H3548><s%> that approach <S%H7138><s%> to the LORD <S%H3068><s%> shall eat <S%H398><s%> the most <S%H6944><s%> holy <S%H6944><s%> things: there <S%H8033><s%> shall they lay <S%H3240><s%> the most <S%H6944><s%> holy <S%H6944><s%> things, and the meat offering, <S%H4503><s%> and the sin <S%H2403><s%> offering, and the trespass <S%H817><s%> offering; for the place <S%H4725><s%> is holy. <S%H6918><s%>

When the priests <S%H3548><s%> enter <S%H935><s%> therein, then shall they not go <S%H3318><s%> out of the holy <S%H6944><s%> place into <S%H413><s%> the utter <S%H2435><s%> court, <S%H2691><s%> but there <S%H8033><s%> they shall lay <S%H3240><s%> their garments <S%H899><s%> wherein <S%H834><s%> they minister; <S%H8334><s%> for they are holy; and shall put <S%H3847><s%> on other <S%H312><s%> garments, <S%H899><s%> and shall approach <S%H7126><s%> to those things which <S%H834><s%> are for the people. <S%H5971><s%>

Now when he had made an end <S%H3615><s%> of measuring <S%H4060><s%> the inner <S%H6442><s%> house, <S%H1004><s%> he brought <S%H3318><s%> me forth <S%H3318><s%> toward <S%H1870><s%> the gate <S%H8179><s%> whose <S%H834><s%> prospect <S%H6440><s%> is toward <S%H1870><s%> the east, <S%H6921><s%> and measured <S%H4058><s%> it round <S%H5439><s%> about.

He measured <S%H4058><s%> the east <S%H6921><s%> side <S%H7307><s%> with the measuring <S%H4060><s%> reed, <S%H7070><s%> five <S%H2568><s%> hundred <S%H520><s%> reeds, <S%H7070><s%> with the measuring <S%H4060><s%> reed <S%H7070><s%> round <S%H5439><s%> about.

He measured <S%H4058><s%> the north <S%H6828><s%> side, <S%H7307><s%> five <S%H2568><s%> hundred <S%H3967><s%> reeds, <S%H7070><s%> with the measuring <S%H4060><s%> reed <S%H7070><s%> round <S%H5439><s%> about.
He measured <S%H4058><s%> the south <S%H1864><s%> side, <S%H7307><s%> five <S%H2568><s%> hundred <S%H3967><s%> reeds, <S%H7070><s%> with the measuring <S%H4060><s%> reed. <S%H7070><s%>

He turned <S%H5437><s%> about to the west <S%H3220><s%> side, <S%H7307><s%> and measured <S%H4058><s%> five <S%H2568><s%> hundred <S%H3967><s%> reeds <S%H7070><s%> with the measuring <S%H4060><s%> reed. <S%H7070><s%>

He measured <S%H4058><s%> it by the four <S%H702><s%> sides: <S%H7307><s%> it had a wall <S%H2346><s%> round <S%H5439><s%> about, five <S%H2568><s%> hundred <S%H3967><s%> reeds long, <S%H753><s%> and five <S%H2568><s%> hundred <S%H3967><s%> broad, <S%H7341><s%> to make a separation <S%H914><s%> between <S%H996><s%> the sanctuary <S%H6944><s%> and the profane <S%H2455><s%> place.
